entry.title: Perturbation Theory
entry.summary: A review article on perturbation theory

entry.title: Causal, psychological, and electrodynamic time arrows as consequences of the thermodynamic time arrow
entry.summary: A clear explanation is given on how the causal, psychological, and electrodynamic time arrows emerge from the thermodynamic time arrow.

entry.title: The energy conservation law in classical electrodynamics
entry.summary: In the framework of the classical Maxwell-Lorentz electrodynamics the energy conservation law is reconsidered.

author.name: E. G. Bessonov
author.arxiv:affiliation: P.N.Lebedev Physical Institute AS, Moscow, Russia

entry.title: Thomas precession angle and spinor algebra
entry.summary: See math-ph/0205036 for an expanded version.

entry.title: Notes on Quasi-Homogeneous Functions in Thermodynamics
entry.summary: A special kind of quasi-homogeneity occurring in thermodynamic potentials of standard thermodynamics is pointed out. Some formal consequences are also discussed.

entry.title: Remarks on photons and the aether
entry.summary: We expand upon some topics reviewed and sketched in a book to appear with more details, embellishments, and some new material of a speculative nature.

entry.title: Why the Langevin-Debye theory of molecular polarization fails in gas phase
entry.summary: The classical polarization theory needs to be changed in gas phase

entry.title: Still the "World's Fastest Derivation of the Lorentz Transformation"
entry.summary: Rothenstein's claim of a ``faster'' derivation of the Lorentz transformation is not correct.

entry.title: Magnetic field with cylindrical symmetry
entry.summary: This short article contains the derivation of a general formula for the magnetostatic field in the neighbourhood of an axis of symmetry.

entry.title: Nanoindentation and nanofriction on DLC films
entry.summary: This submission has been removed by arXiv administration because it was submitted in violation of copyright by HAL.

entry.title: Is Planck's Constant h a "Quantum" Constant?
entry.summary: One should not confuse a physical constant with a theory which incorporates the constant. Planck's constant h can appear in classical or quantum theories.

entry.title: Introduccion a la Teoria de los Monopolos Magneticos
entry.summary: This is a paper with the aim of give the student a detailed calculation of magnetic monopole's Dirac theory.

entry.title: How to Complement the Description of Physical Universe?
entry.summary: Which non-local hidden variables could complement the description of physical Universe? The model of extended Newtonian dynamics is presented.

entry.title: Funciones especiales con aplicaciones a la Mecanica Cuantica y al Electromagnetismo
entry.summary: Special functions and their applications in quantum mechanics and electromagnetism: Course notes.

entry.title: Aharonov-Bohm effect and classical Hamiltonian mechanics
entry.summary: It is shown that Aharonov-Bohm effect may be derived from Hamilton-Jacobi equation. It might have been predicted well before the quantum mechanics creation by Heisenberg and Schroedinger.

entry.title: Note on radiation from an accelerated point charge and non-inertial observers
entry.summary: A simple gedankenexperiment is proposed showing observability of radiation by an observer comoving with an accelerated charge.

entry.title: Classical Mechanics
entry.summary: These notes provide an introduction to a number of those topics in Classical Mechanics that are useful for field theory.

entry.title: Energy, Entropy, Information, and Intelligence
entry.summary: The paper presents a lightweight discussion of relations between energy, entropy, information, and intelligence, based on an analysis of the energy needed for computation.

entry.title: Half-page derivation of the Thomas precession
entry.summary: Instantaneous derivation of the Thomas precession with only basic vector calculus.

entry.title: Spinning particle in a varying magnetic field: how work is done by changing external parameter
entry.summary: The work done by a spinning particle, or on it, when put into a varying magnetic field is discussed.

entry.title: Yet another derivation of special relativity transformations without the second postulate
entry.summary: The most general transformation connecting inertial frames is derived from rather general and simple assumptions, without the postulate of constancy of the speed of light in vacuo.

entry.title: Stringy Maxwell charge and the magnetic dipole moment
entry.summary: It is shown that stringy charge leads naturally to an observable magnetic moment of the electron.

entry.title: Maxwell's Equations in Media and Their Solution
entry.summary: A modified Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction in media is put forward.

entry.title: A Note on the Relativistic Covariance of the $B-$ Cyclic Relations
entry.summary: It is shown that the Evans-Vigier modified electrodynamics is compatible with the Relativity Theory.

entry.title: Nonlinear Maxwell Equations
entry.summary: A new relativistic invariant version of nonlinear Maxwell equations is offerred. Some properties of these equations are considered.

entry.title: Failure of Lorentz-Dirac Approach to Radiation Reaction for Extremely Large Velocities ?
entry.summary: On the model of moving rigid charged body is shown that the Lorentz-Dirac approach to radiation reaction in classical electrodynamics does not work for trajectories of body close to the light cone.

entry.title: Stability of Uniform Rectilinear Motion of Charged Shell in Sommerfeld Model with Self-Action
entry.summary: It is proved that in classical electrodynamics the uniform rectilinear motion of charged "rigid" sphere with self-action (Sommerfeld model) is stable.
entry.arxiv:comment: Dedicated to the 90-anniversary of Moscow State University Professor Anatolii A.Vlasov (1908-1975) (in Latex)

entry.title: Circular Orbits Inside the Sphere of Death
entry.summary: A wheel or sphere rolling without slipping on the inside of a sphere in a uniform gravitational field can have stable circular orbits that lie wholly above the "equator", while a particle sliding freely cannot.

entry.title: Ideal Coinstraints - A Warning Note
entry.summary: A criticism against the conception adopted by some textbook's authors concerning ideal constraints is presented. The criticism is strengthen with two traditional examples.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Revista Brasileira de Ensino de Fisica (RBEF) 22 (2000) 444-445

entry.title: Ball lightning as a possible manifestation of high-temperature superconductivity in Nature
entry.summary: In the superconducting medium the circular current supported by its own magnetic field can exist giving rise to the possible underlying mechanism for the ball lightning.

entry.title: About forces, acting on radiating charge
entry.summary: It is shown, that the force acting on a radiating charge is stipulated by two reasons - owing to exchange of a momentum between radiating charge and electromagnetic field of radiation, and also between a charge and field accompanying the charge.

entry.title: Some Analytical Results on Classical Tunneling of Sommerfeld Particle
entry.summary: A simple example of especially constructed potential barrier enables to show analytically (not numerically) the existence of tunneling effect for a Sommerfeld particle.

entry.title: Short Proof of Jacobi's Identity for Poisson Brackets
entry.summary: Making use of the theory of infinitesimal canonical transformations, a concise proof is given of Jacobi's identity for Poisson brackets.

entry.title: Vector constants of the motion and orbits in the Coulomb/Kepler problem
entry.summary: The equation for the conic sections describing the possible orbits in a potential $V \sim r^{-1}$ is obtained by means of a vector constant of the motion differing from the traditional Laplace-Runge-Lenz vector.

entry.title: Mie Coefficients in Double-layered Sphere Irradiated by a Planar Wave
entry.summary: Both the Mie coefficients and the electromagnetic field distributions in the two-layered sphere containing left-handed media irradiated by a planar electromagnetic wave are presented.

entry.title: Lorentz's theory and special relativity are completely identical
entry.summary: The main content of this paper has been moved into the new version of physics/0308035.
entry.arxiv:comment: The paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: The energy conservation law in classical electrodynamics 2
entry.summary: A logical error in the usual derivation of the energy conservation law is analyzed, and a way to avoid the error is presented.

author.name: E. G. Bessonov
author.arxiv:affiliation: P.N.Lebedev Physical Institute AS, Moscow, Russia

entry.title: Isotropic Radiators
entry.summary: We give two examples of antennas with isotropic radiation patterns. Because these involve elliptically polarized radiation, they evade the "hairy-ball theorem" that suggests isotropic radiation would be impossible.

entry.title: Gaussian Laser Beams via Oblate Spheroidal Waves
entry.summary: We deduce a set of circularly polarized Gaussian laser beam modes via a separation-of-variables solution to the Helmholtz wave equation in oblate spheriodal coordinates. On transforming to cylindrical coordinates these become the well-known Gaussian-Laguerre modes.

entry.title: Magnetostatic Spin Waves
entry.summary: In general, Maxwell's equations require that a wave of magnetic field be accompanied by a wave of electric field, and vice versa. In magnetic media it is possible to have waves of magnetization with negligible electric field. We discuss an example of this based on ferromagnetic spin waves.

entry.title: Maximal Gravity at the Surface of an Asteroid
entry.summary: The maximum strength of gravity at the surface of an object of a given mass is not attained for a spherical shape, but for a small departure from sphericity.

entry.title: A Conducting Checkerboard
entry.summary: The problem of a conducting checkerboard has recently been solved via an elliptic function whose argument is another elliptic function. The behavior of the fields and currents near a vertex of the checkerboard pattern can be discussed by more elementary methods.

entry.title: Group velocity of the acoustic eigen-modes in sonic crystals
entry.summary: In this brief report, the group velocity of the eigen-modes in sonic crystals is derived, and shown to equal the averaged energy velocity of the eigen-modes. How the group velocity can be used to describe acoustic energy flows in sonic crystals is discussed.

entry.title: Testing a Crucial Assumption
entry.summary: Simplified description of an experiment of the Michelson-Morley type being completed at the University of Western Australia with a discussion of the possible meanings of its outcome.

entry.title: Lorentz-contraction formula from non-simultaneous events
entry.summary: We present a derivation of the relativistic length-contraction formula based on Lorentz space-time transformations on non-simultaneous events. Our derivation avoids the disputable story about the stationary observer and its simultaneous measurements of object's end-points.

entry.title: Billiards, Invariant Measures, and Equilibrium Thermodynamics
entry.summary: The questions of justification of the Gibbs canonical distribution for systems with elastic impacts are discussed. A special attention is paid to the description of probability measures with densities depending on the system energy.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Regular and Chaotic Dynamics, 2000 Volume 5 Number 2

entry.title: Electromagnetic Field Particles in the Classical Theory
entry.summary: This simple analysis shows that photon-like particles are not strange within the conceptual framework of the classical electromagnetic field theory. Circular polarized waves lead to photons. Thus, light quantum hypothesis is not necessary.

entry.title: On electromagnetic boundary conditions and constitution of homogeneous materials
entry.summary: Constitutive scalars that are absent in the fundamental differential equations of frequency-domain electromagnetism on the two sides of a boundary between two homogeneous mediums are shown to disappear from the boundary conditions as well.

entry.title: A Note On Stability of Steady Motion of a Rolling Disk
entry.summary: This note adds some critical remarks on the discussion presented in the McDonald's paper ([1]) on stability of steady motion of the well known problem of a disk rolling on a rough horizontal plane.

entry.title: Einstein's relativistic Doppler formula
entry.summary: We note that Einstein's relativistic Doppler formula presents a strange aspect. For incident light received under a fixed non zero angle, the Doppler shift will change from blueshift to redshift (or vice-versa) for some critical relative velocity of the observer and the source.

entry.title: Enhancing switching in bistable nanomechanical oscillators by geometrical resonance
entry.summary: It is shown how the cooperative effect of the geometrical resonance and stochastic resonance mechanisms explains recent results on bistable nanomechanical silicon oscillators (R. L. Badzey and P. Mohanty, Nature, vol. 437, 995-998 (2005)).

entry.title: Remarks on gravity, entropy, and information
entry.summary: This is a partially survey collection of material on gravity, entropy, and information with some new heuristic results related to the WDW equation.

entry.title: Noether's theorem in classical mechanics revisited
entry.summary: A didatic approach of the Noether's theorem in classical mechanics is derived and used to obtain the laws of conservation.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 1 figure, LaTeX article in iopart style

entry.title: Relativistic momentum and kinetic energy, and $E=mc^2$
entry.summary: Based on relativistic velocity addition and the conservation of momentum and energy, I present derivations of the expressions for the relativistic momentum and kinetic energy, and $E=mc^2$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 2 Figures, submitted to American Journal of Physics

entry.title: A simple guide to determine elastic properties of films on substrate from nanoindentation experiments
entry.summary: This submission has been removed by arXiv administration because it was submitted in violation of copyright by HAL.

entry.title: Omega and the time evolution of the N-body problem
entry.summary: The series solution of the behavior of a finite number of physical bodies and Chaitin's Omega number share quasi-algorithmic expressions; yet both lack a computable radius of convergence.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the collection of papers "Randomness and Complexity, from Leibniz to Chaitin," ed. by Cristian S. Calude

entry.title: Force Equation That Describes the Quantum States of a Relativistic Spinless Particle
entry.summary: Newton's second law may be used to obtain a wave equation, which reduces to Schrodinger's equation in the nonrelativistic limit and for a conservative force.

entry.title: A non-perturbative proof of Bertrand's theorem
entry.summary: We discuss an alternative non-perturbative proof of Bertrand's theorem that leads in a concise way directly to the two allowed fields: the newtonian and the isotropic harmonic oscillator central fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex file plus one eps figure

entry.title: New paradox in the special theory of relativity generated by the string dynamics
entry.summary: It is proved that the definition of simultaneity by Einstein leads to the paradox motion of he string from the viewpoint of the observer in the inertial system S' moving with velocity v with regard to the inertial system S.

entry.title: Comment on the paper by Rovelli & al. about the compatibility of various "gauge conditions"
entry.summary: The compatibility "demonstrated" by Rovelli & al. between various "gauge conditions" both in Classical Electromagnetism and General Relativity can be better understood if one distinguishes "gauge conditions" of the solution type and "gauge conditions" of the constraint type.

entry.title: Motion of Hexagonal Pencil on an Inclined Plane
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s), due a crucial sign error in Eqn. 1.

entry.title: Concerning Hidden Momentum
entry.summary: The fact that the author of an excellent textbook on electromagnetism could be duped by "hidden momentum" vividly illustrates the problematic nature of its use.

entry.title: Time desynchronization and Ehrenfest paradox
entry.summary: One of the kinematical effects that give raise to the principle of relativity is time desynchronization of moving clocks. The detailed analysis of this phenomenon is of great importance for leading us to the right (and new) solution of Ehrenfest paradox.

entry.title: A different derivation of the acceleration of a particle in a non-inertial reference frame
entry.summary: A new derivation of the acceleration of a particle in a non-inertial reference frame, including the Coriolis effect, is developed using the geometry of complex numbers in the complex plane.

entry.title: Memristor for Introductory Physics
entry.summary: Using basic algebra and simple calculus, the analytical solution to the memristor model of Strukov et al published in Nature is derived. Lissajous figures of current responding to a sinusoidal voltage are presented.

entry.title: Author's response
entry.summary: This paper replies to the comment by Jefimenko: "Causal equations for electric and magnetic fields and Maxwell's equations: Comment on a paper by Heras" [Am. J. Phys. 76, 101-101 (2008)]."

entry.title: Adding to the paradox: the accelerated twin is older
entry.summary: We discuss a rather surprising version of the twin paradox in which (contrary to the familiar classical version) the twin who accelerates is older on the reunion than his never accelerating brother.

entry.title: Flat spacetime in a capsule
entry.summary: We propose a parallel introduction to Galilean and Einsteinian relativity based on the causal structure and inertial motions. Galilean and Poincare transformations, as objects secondary to the geometrical structure, are left aside.

entry.title: The impact force in the ballistic oscillator
entry.summary: We determine the impact force generated by the projectile penetrating the body of the harmonic oscillator. We discuss the ballistic effect in connection with the Compton effect. Key words: Mathematical pendulum, physical pendulum, ballistic pendulum, harmonic oscillator.

entry.title: Comment on: "A one-way speed of light experiment" by E. D. Greaves, et al. Am. J. Phys. 77(10), 894-896 (2009)
entry.summary: This is a comment on E. D. Greaves et al. paper. We argue that their laboratory experiment cannot be interpreted as measuring the one-way speed of light.

entry.title: On the proper choice of a Lorentz-covariant relativistic Lagrangian
entry.summary: A proper choice for the sign of the Lorentz-covariant relativistic Lagrangian for a particle moving in an electromagnetic field is presented. This choice is based on which space-time metric is used in the representation of the relativistic particle dynamics.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on `Can Maxwell's equations be obtained from the continuity equation?'" by E. Kapuscik [Am. J. Phys. 77, 754 (2009)]
entry.summary: This paper replies the comment by E. Kapuscik [Am. J. Phys. 77, 754 (2009)]

entry.title: Singular behaviour of the electromagnetic field (the static case revisited)
entry.summary: The singularities of the electromagnetic field are derived to include all the point-like multipoles representing an electric charge and current distribution. Partial results obtained in a previous paper are completed to represent accurately all the terms included in these singularities.

entry.title: Sliding rope paradox
entry.summary: A simple mechanical problem is considered which we believe will help students to familiarize some concepts of mechanics of variable mass systems. Meanwhile they can even learn some thrilling physics of bungee jumping.

entry.title: Causality and Peierls Bracket in Classical Mechanics
entry.summary: Relation between the Peierls and the Poisson bracket is derived in classical mechanics of time-dependent systems. Equal-time Peierls brackets are seen to be the same as the Poisson brackets in simple cases but a proof for a general Hamiltonian is lacking.

entry.title: A note on the $δ$-singularities of the static electric and magnetic fields
entry.summary: The $\delta-$singularities of the electric and magnetic fields in the static case are established based on the regularized $\delta_\eps(\rvec)$ function introduced by Jackson.

entry.title: Comment on: Power loss and electromagnetic energy density in a dispersive metamaterial medium
entry.summary: By clarifying the approach of Luan (Phys. Rev. E, 2009), we can generalize the analysis of dispersive (meta)materials, and treat other material responses involving not only loss, but also gain and coherent response.

entry.title: Probabilistic interpretation of mechanical motion
entry.summary: Probabilistic approach to the description of translational motion of macrobodies indicates the emergence of additional order effects oriented in the direction of motion of the body

entry.title: A short proof that the Coulomb-gauge potentials yield the retarded fields
entry.summary: A short demonstration that the potentials in the Coulomb gauge yield the retarded electric and magnetic fields is presented. This demonstration is relatively simple and can be presented in an advanced undergraduate curse of electromagnetic theory,

entry.title: Relativistic accelerating electromagnetic waves
entry.summary: An exact solution of the Maxwell equations in Rindler coordinates is obtained. The electromagnetic field represents a wave preserving its shape in a relativistic uniformly accelerated frame. The relation with Airy beams is shown explicitly in the non-relativistic limit.

entry.title: On the Nonlinear Theory of Viscoelasticity of Differential Type
entry.summary: We consider nonlinear viscoelastic materials of differential type and for some special models we derive exact solutions of initial boundary value problems. These exact solutions are used to investigate the reasons of non-existence of global solutions for such equations.

entry.title: Mechanics of plates
entry.summary: The theory of deformed plates in mechanical equilibrium is formulated and properties of circular plates lifted at the center are discussed.

entry.title: The Kepler Problem: Orbit Cones and Cylinders
entry.summary: Planetary orbits, being conic sections, may be obtained as the locus of intersection of planes and cones. The planes involved are familiar to anyone who has studied the classical Kepler problem. We focus here on the cones.

entry.title: Barn and Pole paradox: revisited
entry.summary: We present two different paradoxes related to the length contraction in special relativity and explain their resolution.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 6 figures. To appear in Physics Education, IOP Science

entry.title: Comment on "Trouble with the Lorentz Law of Force"
entry.summary: A recent article claims the Lorentz force law is incompatible with special relativity. The claim is false, and the "paradox" on which it is based was resolved many years ago.

entry.title: Entropy Change in the Carnot Cycle: Entropy in the Adiabatic Process
entry.summary: Entropy change in the Carnot cycle is discussed. In particular, the isentropic change in the adiabatic expansion (or compression) is reinvestigated.

entry.title: Technical Notes on Classical Electromagnetism, with exercises
entry.summary: The present technical notes offer a brief summary of the essential points of electromagnetism at the undergraduate physics level. Some problems are presented at the end of each section; those with solutions are marked with an asterisk.

entry.title: Generic stability in dissipative generalized mechanics
entry.summary: A theory of dissipative generalized continuum mechanics is presented in the framework of weakly nonlocal non-equilibrium thermodynamics. The evolution equation of microdeformation is obtained by thermodynamic principles. Conditions of generic stability, the linear asymptotic stability of homogeneous equilibrium, is derived in a simple but representative case.

entry.title: Resonances in the heavy symmetrical top with vibrating pivot
entry.summary: In this work we consider a heavy symmetrical top whose pivot is subjected to vertical and horizontal vibrations, and derive a resonance criterion when the top is thrown off the stable position.

entry.title: Rotating frame analysis of rigid body dynamics in space phasor variables
entry.summary: New method of analysing the free and heavy symmetric tops using Euler's equations to perform extraction from the body frame to the lab frame. Subsequent to extraction, the lab frame equations are solved by space phasor method.
entry.arxiv:comment: About 7500 words, to be published in Am. J. Phys

entry.title: A Wave-centric View of Special Relativity
entry.summary: An approach to special relativity is outlined which emphasizes the wave and field mechanisms which physically produce the relativistic effects, with the goal of making them seem more natural to students by connecting more explicitly with prior studies of waves and oscillators.

entry.title: Sull'origine della condizione di quantizzazione delle cariche dei dioni
entry.summary: It is shown that there is a simple way to get the quantization equation for the electric and magnetic charges of dyons, $e_ig_j-g_ie_j=m(\hbar c)$, which also shed light to the origin of such quantization.

entry.title: A new closed-form model for isotropic elastic sphere including new solutions for the free vibrations problem
entry.summary: We develop a new closed-form model for the dynamics of an elastic and isotropic sphere and use it to derive new closed-form resonant frequencies.

entry.title: Notes on the flexible manipulator
entry.summary: The existence of solutions to the boundary tracking of the displacement at one end of a linear Timoshenko beam is discussed on the basis of the Cauchy problem with time and space interchanged.

entry.title: Higher order closed-form model for isotropic hyperelastic spherical shell (3D solid)
entry.summary: Higher order closed-form formulation for Neo-Hookean shell is presented. New solution for natural frequency of free vibration of a hemisphere is derived.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages. arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1312.0083, arXiv:1311.0741

entry.title: Electric Current Multipole Moments in Classical Electrodynamics
entry.summary: The general theory for electric current multipoles appearing at the motion of magnetic dipoles and change in these values or orientation has been suggested. Static multipoles, including an anapole, have been studied in detail.

entry.title: A Paradox Related to Mechanical and Electrical Energy Conversion
entry.summary: A model is constructed and a paradox concerning the proper direction and magnitude of the external force to maintain the equilibrium state of a parallel plate capacitor system is raised. By a thorough study of the model using different methods, the paradox is eliminated.

entry.title: Rigorous Derivations of the Planar Impact Dynamics Equations in the Center-of-Mass Frame
entry.summary: In this article, we present a set of rigorous derivations of the equations used in planar impact dynamics calculations, in the context of vehicular accident reconstruction.

entry.title: On the foundations of the classical relativistic theory of the field of an accelerated extended charge
entry.summary: The effect of nonzero extent of an electric charge is considered within the assumption that the structure of the charge at rest is spherically-symmetric and the current vector is linear in the acceleration.

entry.title: A Generalized Damage-Based Estimate of Crash Severity
entry.summary: In this paper, principles of the CRASH3 damage-based collision algorithm are generalized for 3-dimensional motor vehicle crush profiles.

entry.title: Calculation of Coupling Capacitance in Planar Electrodes
entry.summary: We show how capacitance can be calculated simply and efficiently for electrodes cut in a 2-dimensional ground plane. These results are in good agreement with exact formulas and numerical simulations.

entry.title: A truly elementary proof of Bertrand's theorem
entry.summary: An elementary proof of Bertrand's theorem is given by examining the radial orbit equation, without needing to solve complicated equations or integrals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages with 1 figure. To be published in American Journal of Physics

entry.title: The Karlqvist approximation revisited
entry.summary: The Karlqvist approximation signaling the historical beginning of magnetic recording head theory is reviewed and compared to various approaches progressing from Green, Fourier, Conformal mapping that obeys the Sommerfeld edge condition at angular points and leads to exact results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages and 9 figures. To submit to American Journal of Physics

entry.title: Causal diagrams for physical models
entry.summary: I present a scheme of drawing causal diagrams based on physically motivated mathematical models expressed in terms of temporal differential equations. They provide a means of better understanding the processes and causal relationships contained within such systems.

entry.title: The Ping Pong Pendulum
entry.summary: Many damped mechanical systems oscillate with increasing frequency as the amplitude decreases. One popular example is Euler's Disk, where the point of contact rotates with increasing rapidity as the energy is dissipated. We study a simple mechanical pendulum that exhibits this behaviour.

entry.title: Orbital velocity
entry.summary: The trajectory and the orbital velocity are determined for an object moving in a gravitational system, in terms of fundamental and independent variables. In particular, considering a path on equipotential line, the elliptical orbit is naturally traced, verifying evidently the keplerian laws. The case of the planets of the solar system is presented.

entry.title: Generalization of the Force Approach to Radiation Reaction
entry.summary: A generalization of the force approach to radiation reaction is given, taken into consideration an arbitrary motion of the charged particle . The expression obtained brings about the expression already given for the linear an the circular acceleration cases.

entry.title: A proposal to classify the radian as a base unit in the SI
entry.summary: We propose that the SI be modified so that the radian is a base unit. Some of the details and consequences of such a modification are examined.

entry.title: Pythagorean means and Carnot machines: When music meets heat
entry.summary: Some interesting relations between Pythagorean means (arithmetic, geometric and harmonic means) and the coefficients of performance of reversible Carnot machines (heat engine, refrigerator and heat pump) are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Pedagogic article. latex, 12 pages, 1 figure, 2 tables, 2 boxes

entry.title: Derivation of the Special Theory of Relativity from Invariance of Action
entry.summary: It is known that action is invariant in special relativity. The goal of this note is to show that the reverse statement is also correct, that special relativity follows from the postulate that action is invariant under the transformation from one inertial frame to another.

entry.title: Controllable Angular Scattering with a Bianisotropic Metasurface
entry.summary: We propose the concept of a bianisotropic metasurface with controllable angular scattering. We illustrate this concept with the synthesis and the analysis of a metasurface exhibiting controllable absorption and transmission phase as function of the incidence angle.

entry.title: Spectral decomposition of the Lippmann-Schwinger equation applied to cylinders
entry.summary: We derive the spectral decomposition of the Lippmann-Schwinger equation for electrodynamics, obtaining the fields as a sum of eigenmodes. The method is applied to cylindrical geometries.

entry.title: Electromagnetic energy, momentum and forces in a dielectric medium with losses
entry.summary: From the energy-momentum tensors of the electromagnetic field and the mechanical energy-momentum, the equations of energy conservation and balance of electromagnetic and mechanical forces are obtained. The equation for the Abraham force in a dielectric medium with losses is obtained

entry.title: Classical $v_{gr} \neq c$ solutions of Maxwell equations and the tunneling photon effect
entry.summary: We propose a very simple but general method to construct solutions of Maxwell equations propagating with a group velocity $v_{gr} \neq c$. Applications to wave guides and a possible description of the known experimental evidences on photonic tunneling are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, Latex2e; to be published in Phys. Lett. A

entry.title: An Approach to Maxwell Equations in Uniformly Accelerated Spherical Coordinates by Newman-Penrose Method
entry.summary: Variables are separated in Maxwell equations by the Newman-Penrose method of isotropic complex tetrade in the uniformly accelerated spherical coordinate system. Particular solutions are obtained in terms of spin 1 spherical harmonics. PACS: 03.50.De

author.name: Z. Ya Turakulov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Nuclear Physics Ulugbek, Tashkent, Rep of Uzbekistan, CIS

entry.title: Does the electromagnetic field of an accelerated charge satisfy Maxwell equations?
entry.summary: We considered the electromagnetic field of a charge moving with a constant acceleration along an axis. We found that this field obtained from the Lienard-Wiechert potentials does not satisfy Maxwell equations.

entry.title: Speculations on the Evans-Comay Discussion
entry.summary: The Reply to G. W. Bruhn is added.
entry.arxiv:comment: ReVTeX file, 7+1 pp., no figures. The Reply to G. W. Bruhn is added

entry.title: Electromagnetic Waves in the Vacuum with Torsion and Spin
entry.summary: Exact radiative wave solutions to the classical homogeneous Maxwell equations in the vacuum have been found that are not transverse, exhibit both torsion and spin, and for which the second Poincare invariant, E.B, is not zero. Two four component rank 3 tensors of spin current and torsion are constructed on topological grounds. The divergence of each pseudo vector generates the Poincare invariants of the electromagnetic system.

entry.title: Anomalous scaling behavior in Takens-Bogdanov bifurcations
entry.summary: A general algorithm is presented for estimating the nonlinear instability threshold, $\sigma_c$, for subcritical transitions in systems where the linearized dynamics is significantly non-normal (i.e. subcritical bifurcations of {\em Takens-Bogdanov} type). The $N$-dimensional degenerate node is presented as an example. The predictions are then compared to numerical studies with excellent agreement.

entry.title: Locality, QED and Classical Electrodynamics
entry.summary: We report on some conceptual changes in our present understanding of Quantum Field Theory and muse about possible consequences for the understanding of $v>c$ signals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6p., talk given at the Cologne workshop $v>(?)c$, latex, epsf for figures

entry.title: One-Dimensional Motion of Sommerfeld Sphere in Potential Hole in Classical Electrodynamics: Inside the Hole
entry.summary: Equation of motion of Sommerfeld sphere in the one-dimensional potential hole, produced by two equal charges on some distance from each other, is numerically investigated. Two types of solutions are found: (i) damping oscillations, (ii) oscillations without damping (radiationless motion). Solutions with growing amplitude ("climbing-up-the-wall solution") for chosen initial conditions were not founded.

entry.title: On the Discontinuity of Electrostatic Fields Across a Planar Surface With Multipolar Surface Charge Density
entry.summary: We use covariance and dimensional analysis to find expressions for the discontinuity of the potential and normal electric field across a flat surface with multipolar charge surface density in vacuum.

author.name: S. Gov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Electronics, Weizmann Institute of Science, Rehovot, Israel

author.name: H. Matzner
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Electronics, Weizmann Institute of Science, Rehovot, Israel

entry.title: An axiomatic framework for classical particle mechanics without space-time
entry.summary: We present an axiomatic framework for non-relativistic classical particle mechanics, inspired on Tati's ideas about a non-space-time description for physics. The main advantage of our picture is that it allows us to describe causality without any reference to elapsed time intervals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, no figures, LaTeX. This paper will appear in Philos. Natur. 2 (1999)

entry.title: Classical Tunneling of Sommerfeld Sphere in Classical Electrodynamics
entry.summary: One-dimensional motion of Sommerfeld sphere in the case of potential barrier is numerically investigated. The effect of classical tunneling is found out - Sommerfeld sphere overcomes the barrier and finds itself in the forbidden, from classical point of view, area.

entry.title: Entropy Decrease in Isolated Systems with an Internal Wall undergoing Brownian Motion
entry.summary: We consider an isolated gaseous system, divided in two parts by an adiabatic movable frictionless internal wall undergoing Brownian motion. We show how this kind of motion can lead to a substantial decrease of the system entropy. This surprising result does not violate Boltzmann's H-theorem since the molecular chaos assumption underlying H-theorem is not fulfilled by our system.

entry.title: Renormalization Group Studies of Vertex Models
entry.summary: In this thesis we use renormalization group methods to study the critical behaviour of the staggered F-model. This model is a six vertex model that can be used to calculate the thermodynamic properties of a facet of a BCC crystal in the (100) direction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 55 pages, latex. Corrected some typos and simplified the free fermion expansion

entry.title: Classical Tunneling as the Result of Retardation in Classical Electrodynamics: Nonrelativistic Case
entry.summary: In nonrelativistic approximation one-dimensional motion of Sommerfeld sphere in the case of potential barrier is numerically investigated. The effect of classical tunneling is confirmed once more - Sommerfeld sphere overcomes the barrier and finds itself in the forbidden, from classical point of view, area.

entry.title: Excitation of resonators by electron beams
entry.summary: In this paper the main consequences of the vector theory of excitation of resonators by particle beams are presented. Some features of excitation of broadband radiation in longitudinal modes of the enclosed and open resonators are discussed.

author.name: Yukio Shibata
author.arxiv:affiliation: Research Institute for Scientific Measurements, Tohoku University, Japan

author.name: Satoshi Sasaki
author.arxiv:affiliation: Research Institute for Scientific Measurements, Tohoku University, Japan

author.name: Kimihiro Ishi
author.arxiv:affiliation: Research Institute for Scientific Measurements, Tohoku University, Japan

author.name: Mikihiko Ikezawa
author.arxiv:affiliation: Research Institute for Scientific Measurements, Tohoku University, Japan

author.name: E. G. Bessonov
author.arxiv:affiliation: Lebedev Physical Institute AS, Moscow, Russia

entry.title: A bounded source cannot emit a unipolar electromagnetic wave
entry.summary: We show that a bounded source cannot produce a unipolar electromagnetic pulse. As a consequence, there are no three-dimensional electromagnetic solitons in vacuum.
entry.arxiv:comment: v2 adds one reference: thanks to Evgueni Bessonov

entry.title: Vector constants of motion for time-dependent Kepler and isotropic harmonic oscillator potentials
entry.summary: A method of obtaining vector constants of motion for time-independent as well as time-dependent central fields is discussed. Some well-established results are rederived in this alternative way and new ones obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, no figures, regular Latex article format

entry.title: Dirac monopole with Feynman brackets
entry.summary: We introduce the magnetic angular momentum as a consequence of the structure of the sO(3) Lie algebra defined by the Feynman brackets. The Poincare momentum and Dirac magnetic monopole appears as a direct result of this framework.

entry.title: Sommerfeld Particle in Static Magnetic Field: Tunneling and Delayed Untwisting in Cyclotron
entry.summary: Motion of a charged particle with finite size, described by Sommerfeld model, in static magnetic field has two peculiar features: 1.) there is the effect of tunneling - Sommerfeld particle overcomes the barrier and finds itself in the forbidden, from classical point of view, area; 2.) the untwisting of trajectory in cyclotron for Sommerfeld particle is strongly delayed compared to that of a classical particle.

entry.title: A mechanical model that exhibits a gravitational critical radius
entry.summary: Circular orbits of a particle sliding on a frictionless surface of revolution about a vertical axis are unstable below a critical radius if the curvature of the surface satisfies a specified condition. This behavior can be realized in a mechanical model, which give a glimpse of the greater complexity of particle orbits in curved rather than flat spacetime.

entry.title: Comment on ``Do Zero-energy Solutions of Maxwell Equations Have the Physical Origin Suggested by A. E. Chubykalo?" by V.V. Dvoeglazov
entry.summary: This is the answer to objections put forth in Proceedings of the Zacatecas Workshop "Lorentz Group, CPT and Neutrinos" (World Scientific, Singapore, 2000), pp. 335-341.

entry.title: Coulomb Interaction Does Not Spread Instantaneously
entry.summary: The experiment is described which shows that Coulomb interaction spreads with a limit velocity and thus this kind of interaction cannot be considered as so called "instantaneous action at a distance".
entry.arxiv:comment: ReVTeX file, 13 pages, 8 figures, to be published in ``Hadronic Journal"

entry.title: Comment on ``Dependence of Gravitational Action on Chemical Composition: New Series of Experiments" by M. Nanni [Apeiron v. 7, No. 3-4, pp. 195-201]
entry.summary: In our comment we show that the application of appropriate statistical methods to the results of the author proves that the author in his article has not been able to reach his goal.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX file, 3pp., to be published in "Apeiron"

entry.title: Coarse graining: lessons from simple examples
entry.summary: We assess Coarse Graining by studying different partitions of the phase space of the Baker transformation and the periodic torus automorphisms. It turns out that the shape of autocorrelation functions for the Baker transformation is more or less reproduced. However, for certain partitions the decay rates turn out to be irrelevant, even decay may stop in a finite time. For the periodic torus automorphisms, Coarse Graining introduces artificial dumping.

entry.title: Equations of Motion of Systems with Internal Angular Momentum
entry.summary: Using Euler's equations of motion and the Hamiltonian formulation, we obtain the equations of motion of systems with internal angular momentum that are moving with respect to a given reference frame, when subjected to a torque which is permanently perpendicular to the angular momentum vector.

entry.title: On non-measurable sets and invariant tori
entry.summary: The question: "How many different trajectories are there on a single invariant torus within the phase space of an integrable Hamiltonian system?" is posed. A rigorous answer to the question is found both for the rational and the irrational tori. The relevant notion of non-measurable sets is discussed.

entry.title: Delay Equation for Charged Brown Particle
entry.summary: In previous work (physics/0004026) was shown, with the help of numerical calculations, that the effective Brown temperature for charged particle is lower than that for particle without charge. Here we derive this result without numerical calculations, integrating the delay equation analytically, as for zero, so for nonzero viscosity.

entry.title: Basics of Superluminal Signals
entry.summary: The paper elucidates the physical basis of experimental results on superluminal signal velocity. It will be made plausible that superluminal signals do not violate the principle of causality but they can shorten the luminal vacuum time span between cause and effect. This amazing behaviour is based on the property that any physical signal has a finite duration.

entry.title: A foundational approach to physics
entry.summary: A core level of basic information for physics is identified, based on an analysis of the characteristics of the parameters space, time, mass and charge. At this level, it is found that certain symmetries operate, which can be used to explain certain physical facts and even to derive new mathematical theorems. Applications are made to classical mechanics, electromagnetic theory and quantum mechanics.

entry.title: An analytically solvable three-body problem
entry.summary: The problem of three particles interacting through harmonic forces is discussed within the Newtonian formalism. By means of a didactic approach, an exact analytical solution is found, and ways to extend it to the N-body case are pointed out.
entry.arxiv:comment: In Portuguese. To appear in Revista Brasileira de Ensino de Fisica (RBEF)

entry.title: Multi-parameter generalization of nonextensive statistical mechanics
entry.summary: We show that the stochastic interpretation of Tsallis' thermostatistics given recently by Beck [Phys. Rev. Lett {\bf 87}, 180601 (2001)] leads naturally to a multi-parameter generalization. The resulting class of distributions is able to fit experimental results which cannot be reproduced within the Boltzmann's or Tsallis' formalism.

entry.title: Methods of Laser Cooling of Electron Beams in Storage Rings
entry.summary: Methods of enhanced laser cooling of particle beams in storage rings and Robinson's damping criterion are discussed. The dynamics of amplitudes of betatron oscillations and instantaneous orbits of electrons interacting with laser beams being displaced in the radial direction is investigated.

author.name: E. G. Bessonov
author.arxiv:affiliation: P.N.Lebedev Physical Institute AS, Moscow, Russia

entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LaTeX, Discussion of Robinson's critrion is added

entry.title: Analytical calculation of the Peierls-Nabarro pinning barrier for one-dimensional parametric double-well models
entry.summary: Lattice effects on the kink families of two models for one-dimensional nonlinear Klein-Gordon systems with double-well on-site potentials are considered. The analytical expression of the generalized Peierls-Nabarro pinning potential is obtained and confronted with numerical simulations.

entry.title: An electromagnetic trinity from "negative permittivity" and "negative permeability"
entry.summary: An electromagnetic trinity comprising vacuum, anti--vacuum, and nihility is postulated -- after making use of materials with "negative permittivity" and "negative permeability" -- to illuminate the structure of electromagnetic theory, at least insofar as the relationship of phase velocity with Poynting vector is concerned.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Int. J. Infrared Millim. Waves, Vol. 23, pp. 813-818 (2002)

entry.title: On Perfect Lenses and Nihility
entry.summary: The canonical problem of a perfect lens with linear bianisotropic materials is formulated. Its solution is shown to be directly connected with the concept of nihility, the electromagnetic nilpotent. Perfect lenses as well as nihility remain unrealizable.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Journal of Infrared and Millimeter Waves, Vol. 23, No. 3, pp. 339-343 (March 2002)

entry.title: The Theory of vacuum and some practical results
entry.summary: Vacuum, where matter exists is an objective reality of Nature. It has a structure consists of electrical massless dipoles. This structure is responsible for gravitation, inertia and propagation of light. The structure can be influenced by the electrical, magnetic forces and by radiation and thus control the gravitation and inertia.

entry.title: Excitation of Resonators by Electron Beams
entry.summary: Elements of a vector theory of open resonators and experiments on excitation of a fundamental mode with transverse and longitudinal polarization in such resonators are discussed.

author.name: E. G. Bessonov
author.arxiv:affiliation: P.N.Lebedev Physical Institute AS, Moscow, Russia

entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX, Presented to Proc. 23 Int. Free Electron Laser Conf. FEL2001, 20-24 Aug. 2001, Darmstadt, Germany

entry.title: Reversed Circular Dichroism of Isotropic Chiral Mediums with Negative Real permeability and permittivity
entry.summary: Negative real parts of the permittivity and permeability lead an isotropic chiral medium to exhibit circular dichroism that is reversed with respect to that exhibited by an identical medium but the real parts of whose permittivity and permeability are positive.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Microwave and Optical Technology Letters, Vol. 33, No. 2, pp. 96-97 (2002)

entry.title: Remarks on the Physical Meaning of Diffraction-Free Solutions of Maxwell Equations
entry.summary: It is proved that a source of electromagnetic radiation cannot emit a diffraction-free beam at the wave zone. A Bessel $J_0$ $\phi $-invariant beam does not hold even at the intermediate zone. These results negate claims published recently in the literature.

entry.title: Comments on "A gravitational shielding based upon ZnS:Ag phosphor" and "The gravitational mass at the superconducting state"
entry.summary: This is a discussion of two recent papers by De Aquino [physics/0112081 (2001) and physics/0201058 (2002)] that put forward an explanation of observations of gravity shielding originally reported by Podkletnov and Nieminen [Physica C 203 441 (1992)].

author.name: R. C. Woods
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Iowa State University

entry.title: Negative index of refraction and distributed Bragg reflectors
entry.summary: The Bragg regime shifts when conventional materials in a multilayer distributed Bragg reflector (DBR) are replaced by artificial materials with the so-called negative index of refraction. This provides an avenue for characterizing the latter class of materials.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Microw Opt Technol Lett, Vol 34, No 6, pp 409-411, 2002

entry.title: Delayed Equation for Charged Rigid Nonrelativistic Ball
entry.summary: Simple expression for self-force acting on radiating rigid charged ball is derived (Sommerfeld ball). It is shown that appropriate delayed equation of motion has solutions in general differ from that for Sommerfeld sphere - there are no "radiationless" solutions, but there are oscillating without damping solutions though self-force has nonzero value.

entry.title: Reply to "Criticism of `Necessity of Simultaneous Co-Existence of Instantaneous and Retarded Interactions in Classical Electrodynamics' " by J.D.Jackson
entry.summary: In this note we show that Jackson's criticism (hep-ph/0203076) of our work "Necessity of simultaneous co-existence of..." is based on an inexact understanding of the basic assumptions and conclusions of our work.
entry.arxiv:comment: submitted to Int. J. Mod. Phys

entry.title: Infinite square well and periodic trajectories in classical mechanics
entry.summary: We examine the classical problem of an infinite square well by considering Hamilton's equations in one dimension and Hamilton-Jacobi equation for motion in two dimensions. We illustrate, by means of suitable examples, the nature of the periodic motion of a particle trapped inside the well.

entry.title: Spectral response of Cantor multilayers made of materials with negative refractive index
entry.summary: Whereas Cantor multilayers made of an isotropic dielectric-magnetic material with positive refractive index will show power-law characteristics, low-order Cantor multilayers made of materials with negative refractive index will not exhibit the power-law nature. A reason for this anomalous behavior is presented.

entry.title: Toward a Universal Model of Damping--Modified Coulomb Friction
entry.summary: A modification of Coulomb's law of friction uses a variable coefficient of friction that depends on a power law in the energy of mechanical oscillation. Through the use of three different exponents: 0, 1/2 and 1; all commonly encountered non-viscous forms of damping are accommodated. The nonlinear model appears to yield good agreement with experiment in cases of surface, internal, and amplitude dependent damping.

entry.title: Response to Compagno and Persico
entry.summary: Some mathematically incorrect claims of Compagno and Persico in their reply (2002 J. Phys. A: Math. Gen. 35, 8965) to my comment on their recent paper on self-dressing and radiation reaction in classical electrodynamics are pointed out.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, REVTeX. This version employs a general analytic proof instead of arguing by using a specific example

entry.title: Laser Cooling of Nuclear Beams in Storage Rings
entry.summary: Laser cooling of nuclear beams in storage rings is discussed. The main properties of nuclei with isomeric levels in the range E<50 keV are presented.

author.name: E. G. Bessonov
author.arxiv:affiliation: P.N.Lebedev Physical Institute AS, Moscow, Russia

author.name: E. V. Tkalya
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Nuclear Physics, Moscow State University, Moscow, Russia

entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, LaTeX, New element Pt and important references added

entry.title: Oscillator damping with more than one mechanism of internal friction dissipation
entry.summary: The author's modified Coulomb damping model has been generalized to accommodate internal friction that derives from several dissipation mechanisms acting simultaneously. Because of its fundamental nonlinear nature, internal friction damping causes the quality factor Q of an oscillator in free-decay to change in time. Examples are given which demonstrate reasonable agreement between theory and experiment.

entry.title: Nothing but Relativity
entry.summary: We deduce the most general space-time transformation laws consistent with the principle of relativity. Thus, our result contains the results of both Galilean and Einsteinian relativity. The velocity addition law comes as a bi-product of this analysis. We also argue why Galilean and Einsteinian versions are the only possible embodiments of the principle of relativity.

entry.title: Anisotropic Internal Friction Damping
entry.summary: The mechanical damping properties of sheet polaroid material have been studied with a physical pendulum. The polaroid samples were placed under the knife-edges of the pendulum, which was operated in free-decay at a period in the vicinity of 10 s. With the edges oriented parallel to the direction of the long molecular chains in the polaroid, it was found that the damping was more than 10% smaller than when oriented perpendicular to the chains.

entry.title: Analisi dimensionale: due interessanti applicazioni (Dimensional analysis: two interesting applications)
entry.summary: Dimensional analysis techniques are used to describe (not only qualitatively) some interesting features of two specific physical processes: the kinematics of moving objects on the surface of a planet (e.g. the walking pace of a man on the Moon) and the run-up process of a tsunami wave approaching the shore.

entry.title: Ruchhardt Oscillator Decay- Thermodynamic basis for Hysteretic Damping
entry.summary: Using thermodynamic arguments based on the ideal gas law, it is shown that hysteretic (also called structural) damping is the natural form of energy dissipation for this classic oscillator that is used to measure the ratio of heat capacities for a gas.

entry.title: Comment on `Vector potential of the Coulomb gauge'
entry.summary: The expression for the Coulomb-gauge vector potential in terms of the `instantaneous' magnetic field derived by Stewart [2003 Eur. J. Phys. 24, 519] by employing Jefimenko's equation for the magnetic field and Jackson's formula for the Coulomb-gauge vector potential can be proven much more simply.
entry.arxiv:comment: REVTeX, 3 pages. The same version as that which will appear in European Journal of Physics

entry.title: Celestial mechanics, from high-school to Newton's Principia
entry.summary: A high-school exercise is used to get an insight into planetary motion.
entry.arxiv:comment: Revised and extended version. Alltogether 10 solutions of a high-school contest problem, including original proofs of Maxwell and of Newton, are presented. 11 pages, 4 eps figures

entry.title: Propagation of Fronts and Information in Dispersive Media
entry.summary: We present a general proof based on Kramers-Kronig relations that, in a normal or anomalous dispersive linear medium, any (discontinuitynonanalytic disturbance) in an electromagnetic pulse can not propagate faster than the phase velocity, $c$. Consequently the information carried by the discontinuity (nonanalytical disturbance) can not be transmitted superluminally.

entry.title: Relativistic analysis of Michelson-Morley experiments and Miller's cosmic solution for the Earth's motion
entry.summary: A simple relativistic treatment of Michelson-Morley type of experiments shows the remarkable internal consistency of 1932 Miller's cosmic solution v_{earth} \sim 208 km/s deduced from the experimental fringe shifts observed with his apparatus. The same analysis of present-day experiments is in good agreement with the existing data.

entry.title: On the Faster-Than-Light Motions in Electrodynamics
entry.summary: A variant of electrodynamics is constructed in which faster-than-light motions are possible.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, LaTeX, Report at the XIIth International Conference on Selected Problems of Modern Physics, Section 1, Dubna, Russia, June 8-11, 2003, http://thsun1.jinr.ru/~pqft
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. XIIth Int. Conf. on Selected Problems of Modern Physics, Dubna 2003, D1, 2-2003-219, 143-147

entry.title: A Remark on the Kramers Problem
entry.summary: We present new point of view on the old problem, the Kramers problem. The passage from the Fokker-Planck equation to the Smoluchowski equation, including corrections to the Smoluchowski current, is treated through an asymptotic expansion of the solution of the stochastic dynamical equations. The case of an extremely weak force of friction is also discussed
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Stat. Phys. Vol. 96, Nos.5/6, p.1350 (1999)

entry.title: Methods of electron beam bunching
entry.summary: A review of electron beam bunching methods and new bunching methods are presented. Linear accelerator, storage ring and buncher technologies offer high-beam quality and short bunches necessary for operation of high efficiency, high-power, high-degree monochromatic prebunched FELs in optical and X-ray regions.

author.name: E. G. Bessonov
author.arxiv:affiliation: P.N.Lebedev Physical Institute AS, Moscow, Russia

entry.title: Boltzmann's H-theorem and time irreversibility
entry.summary: It is shown that the justification of the Boltzman H-theorem needs more than just the assumption of molecular chaos and the picture of time irreversibility related to it should be reinvestigated.

entry.title: Hidden Momentum in a Coaxial Cable
entry.summary: As an illustration of the concept of "hidden" mechanical momentum, we consider a coaxial cable one end of which is connected to a battery and the other to a load resistor. The nonzero electromagnetic momentum of this configuration is balanced by the slight difference in the mechanical momenta of the conduction electrons in the inner and outer conductors.

entry.title: A Capacitor Paradox
entry.summary: Consider two capacitors in parallel, but initially isolated by a switch such that one is charged and the other not. After the switch is closed, the charges redistribute themselves in such a way that the final electrostatic energy is less than the initial. We show that the "missing" energy has been radiated away by including an appropriate form of the radiation action in an equivalent circuit analysis.

entry.title: Negative optical refractive index resulting from a moving regular medium
entry.summary: The optical refractive index of a moving regular medium is calculated by using the Lorentz transformation in this note. It is shown that in some velocity region of medium moving relative to the initial frame K, the moving medium may possess a negative index of refraction measured by the observer fixed at the frame of reference K.

entry.title: Enhanced radiometric forces
entry.summary: Crookes' Radiometer exploits thermal forces arising from temperature gradients in rarefied gases. This instrument has remained confined to educational physics because of the very small size of the radiometric effect and because of the necessity of an evacuated environment for operation. In this article the physics of this instrument is reviewed, different theories are compared and some general principles are derived. A method for enhancing the radiometric effect and for generating radiometric forces at higher pressures is proposed.

entry.title: On the genesis of Post constraint in modern electromagnetism
entry.summary: The genesis of the Post constraint is premised on two attributes of modern electromagnetism: (i) its microscopic nature, and (ii) the status of e and b as the primitive electromagnetic fields. This constraint can therefore not arise in EH--electromagnetism, wherein the primitive electromagnetic fields are the macroscopic fields E and H.

entry.title: On Temperature Radiation
entry.summary: In this work we compare two blackbody interpretations, those of G. Kirchhoff and M. Planck. We separate the problem of interpreting the blackbody spectrum from that of determining the mechanical equivalent of radiation. Then we propose that, if we set aside characterization of the blackbody, electromagnetism suffices to analyze spectral distribution and leads to interpreting it as determined by the receiver band-pass.

entry.title: "Pseudo" pseudo forces in gauge synchronization theories
entry.summary: The role of extra terms in Newton's second law that arise as a result of non-Einstein synchronization is explored. Although such extra terms have been interpreted as pseudo forces that constrain physical theory to a unique method of synchronization (the Einstein, or standard, synchronization), a fully relativistic analysis indicates that such extra terms do not invalidate the conventionalist thesis of synchronization.

entry.title: On the Possibility of Faster-Than-Light Motions in Nonlinear Electrodynamics
entry.summary: A version of electrodynamics is constructed in which faster-than-light motions of electromagnetic fields and particles with real masses are possible.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, Report at the Fifth International Conference Symmetry in Nonlinear Mathematical Physics, Kyiv, Ukraine, June 23-29, 2003, http://www.imath.kiev.ua/~appmath/conf.html
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of Institute of Mathematics of NAS of Ukraine, 50 (2004) 835-842

entry.title: Random Walks and Effective Resistances on Toroidal and Cylindrical Grids
entry.summary: A mapping between random walk problems and resistor network problems is described and used to calculate the effective resistance between any two nodes on an infinite two-dimensional square lattice of unit resistors. The superposition principle is then used to find effective resistances on toroidal and cylindrical square lattices.

entry.title: Induction and Mutually Obstructing Equilibria
entry.summary: A unified, consistent and simple view of the Faraday law of induction is presented, which consists of two points: discriminating the lab- from the rest-frame electric field and understanding it is the impossibility for both fields to vanish simultaneously, which generates and maintains the circular current. A number of illustrative examples are considered, including a mechano-electric pendulum to exhibit periodic and reversible conversion between electrical and mechanical energy.

entry.title: Experimental test of magnetic photons
entry.summary: A "magnetic" photon hypothesis associated with magnetic monopoles is tested experimentally. These photons are predicted to easily penetrate metal. Experimentally the optical transmittance T of a metal foil was less than 2 x 10^-17. The hypothesis is not supported since it predicts T = 2 x 10^-12.

entry.title: On the Electrodynamics with Faster-Than-Light Motion
entry.summary: The version of electrodynamics is constructed in which faster-than-light motions of fields and particles with real masses are possible. Transformational properties of 3-velocity, momentum, energy and electromagnetic field are presented in addition to the paper physics/0405085.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Has the Last Word Been Said on Classical Electrodynamics? - New Horizons, Editors: A. Chubykalo, V. Onoochin, A. Espinoza, R. Smirnov-Rueda, Rinton Press, 2004, 71-81

entry.title: A note on Dolby and Gull on radar time and the twin "paradox"
entry.summary: Recently a suggestion has been made that standard textbook representations of hypersurfaces of simultaneity for the travelling twin in the twin "paradox" are incorrect. This suggestion is false: the standard textbooks are in agreement with a proper understanding of the relativity of simultaneity.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, 3 pages, 2 figures. Update: added new section V and updated references

entry.title: Electrodynamics on the Moebius Strip
entry.summary: In this diploma work electrostatics and -dynamics of two dimensional structures are examined. Mathematica is used for visualisation and packages for Mathematica have been programmed which use subroutines written in C to improve numerical calculations. The well known Moebius Strip is used as an example structure throughout the work.
entry.arxiv:comment: Associated files and higher resolution images can be found at http://k3.itp.tuwien.ac.at/~gernot/

entry.title: Rectangular Parallelepiped Vibration in Plane Strain State
entry.summary: In this paper we present a vibration spectrum of a homogenous parallelepiped (HP) under the action of volume and surface forces resulting from the exponent displacements entering the Fourier transforms. Vibration under the action of axial surface tractions and the free vibration are described separately. A relationship between the high frequency vibration and boundary conditions (BC) is also considered.

entry.title: On the satiability of floating bodies
entry.summary: The potential energy of a system in stable equilibrium has a minimum value. This property is used to derive a formula that is useful in determi- nation of stability of a floating body. It is found that a floating body is in stable equilibrium if its center of gravity has a minimum height with respect to its related center of buoyancy.

entry.title: A Hilbert-space formulation of and variational principle for spontaneous wiggler radiation
entry.summary: Within the framework of Hilbert space theory, we derive a maximum-power variational principle applicable to classical spontaneous radiation from prescribed harmonic current sources. Results are first derived in the paraxial limit, then appropriately generalized to non-paraxial situations. The techniques were developed within the context of undulator radiation from relativistic electron beams, but are more broadly applicable.

entry.title: Field of the Current Pulse Moving Along the Straight Line with Super Light Velocity
entry.summary: A simulation of electric current pulses formed by a packet of gamma-quanta moving through an absorptive medium is presented. The electromagnetic fields of the current pulse moving along the straight line with super light velocity are obtained

entry.title: Deriving relativistic momentum and energy. II. Three-dimensional case
entry.summary: We generalise a recent derivation of the relativistic expressions for momentum and kinetic energy from the one-dimensional to the three-dimensional case.

entry.title: On the Nature of the Relativity Principle
entry.summary: We discuss the nature and a general formulation of the relativity principle and we show that it can be justified starting from a strictly operational point of view. We give some remark on the connection with the spacetime symmetry groups. We also propose that the relativity principle can be considered as a definition of physics, that distinguishes it from the other scientific disciplines.

entry.title: Relativistic Temperature Transformation Revisited, One hundred years after Relativity Theory
entry.summary: An attempt has been made to find a consistent and logical form for relativistic temperature transformation. Other works in this area have been discussed. Our approach is based on the kinetic theory of ideal gases.

entry.title: Plane electromagnetic wave in PEMC
entry.summary: Plane electromagnetic wave propagating in perfect electromagnetic conductor (PEMC) is considered. Its wave number has no connection with the frequency. An interface is introduced between an ordinary isotropic medium and PEMC. The wave in PEMC is matched to plane electromagnetic wave incident normally on the interface from the ordinary medium and reflected from it. Then the plane-parallel slab made of PEMC is considered and a plane wave is found in it.

entry.title: An Analytical Solution of the Equations of a Rolling Disk of Finite Thickness on a Rough Plane
entry.summary: In this article an analytical solution of equations of motion of a rigid disk of finite thickness rolling on its edge on a perfectly rough horizontal plane under the action of gravity is given. The solution is given in terms of Gauss hypergeometrical functions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Journal of Non-Linear Mechanics, Volume 41, Issues 6-7, July-September 2006, Pages 850-859

entry.title: Multipole Radiation in Lorentz Gauge
entry.summary: The multipole expansion for electromagnetic radiation, valid for all wave-lengths and all distances from bounded sources, is presented in Lorentz gauge, rather than the usual Coulomb gauge. This gauge is likely to be preferred in applications where one wishes to maintain manifest Lorentz invariance. The presentation also serves as a useful exercise in the use of vector spherical harmonics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages. Title changed and type corrected

entry.title: Sur un effet physique attribuable uniquement au potentiel vecteur en électromagnétisme classique
entry.summary: We present the theory, the design and the discussion of an experiment which allows to choose between the local formulation of Riemann-Lorenz and the non-local formulation of Heaviside-Hertz in order to describe Classical Electromagnetism.

entry.title: Multipolar radiation and the gauge invariant reduction of multipole tensors
entry.summary: Compact general formulae for the energy, momentum and angular momentum radiated by confined systems of charges and currents are presented in terms of their multipole Cartesian tensors. Besides the usual electric and magnetic multipoles, a family of toroid (anapole) electromagnetic tensors, as well as some mean squared radii contributions are standed out through a method given in previous works of the authors.

entry.title: Inverse problem for the retarded field of an arbitrary moving charge
entry.summary: It is assumed that the Lienard-Wiechert fields of an arbitrary moving charge is measured or predefined as a function of time. The position of the charge is calculated as a function of the retarded time.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX2e, 6 pages, published in Physics Letters A

entry.title: Entropy, geometry, and the quantum potential
entry.summary: We sketch and emphasize the automatic emergence of a quantum potential Q in e.g. classical WDW type equations upon inserting a (Bohmian) complex wave function. The interpretation of Q in terms of momentum fluctuations via Fisher information and entropy ideas is discussed along with the essentially forced role of the amplitude squared as a probability density. We also review the constructions of Padmanabhan connecting entropy and the Einstein equations.

entry.title: Acoustic identification of a poroelastic cylinder
entry.summary: We show how to cope with the acoustic identification of poroelastic materials when the specimen is in the form of a cylinder. We apply our formulation, based on the Biot model, approximated by the equivalent elastic solid model, to a long bone-like or borehole sample specimen probed by low frequency sound.

entry.title: Evaporating Drops of Alkane Mixtures
entry.summary: Alkane mixtures are model systems where the influence of surface tension gradients during the spreading and the evaporation of wetting drops can be easily studied. The surface tension gradients are mainly induced by concentration gradients, mass diffusion being a stabilising process. Depending on the relative concentration of the mixture, a rich pattern of behaviours is obtained.

entry.title: Expressions for frictional and conservative force combinations within the dissipative Lagrange-Hamilton formalism
entry.summary: Dissipative Lagrangians and Hamiltonians having Coulomb, viscous and quadratic damping,together with gravitational and elastic terms are presented for a formalism that preserves the Hamiltonian as a constant of the motion. Their derivations are also shown. The resulting L's and H's may prove useful in exploring new types of damped quantum systems.

entry.title: The lack of rotation in the Trouton-Noble experiment
entry.summary: The absence of any tendency toward rotation in the Trouton-Noble experiment is given a simple explanation.
entry.arxiv:comment: The derivations have been extended to more general cases. Title has been changed

entry.title: On the Solution of Maxwell's First Order Equations
entry.summary: In an attempt to solve Maxwell's first order system of equations, starting from a given initial state, it is found that a consistent solution depending on the temporal evolution of the sources cannot be calculated. The well known retarded solutions of the second order equations, which are based on the introduction of potentials, turn out to be in disagreement with a direct solution of the first order system.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 1 figure, submitted to Journal of Physics A

entry.title: On the vector solutions of Maxwell equations with the spin-weighted spherical harmonics
entry.summary: The discussion of our recent work concerning the vector solution of boundary-value problems in electromagnetism is extended to the case of no azimuthal symmetry by means of the spin-weighted spherical harmonics.

entry.title: Multipole Moments of Fractal Distribution of Charges
entry.summary: In this paper we consider the electric multipole moments of fractal distribution of charges. To describe fractal distribution, we use the fractional integrals. The fractional integrals are considered as approximations of integrals on fractals. In the paper we compute the electric multipole moments for homogeneous fractal distribution of charges.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Modern Physics Letters B. Vol.19. Vol.22. (2005) 1107-1118

entry.title: Collapsing Solutions of the Maxwell Equations
entry.summary: We derive the essential space-time spectrum of the Maxwell equations in linear isotropic inhomogeneous media together with the corresponding essential modes. These modes represent the collapse of the electromagnetic field into a single point in space at a single angular frequency. The location and frequency of the essential mode are random variables obeying the Born statistical postulate.

entry.title: The Falling Time of an Inverted Plane Pendulum
entry.summary: The article provides the formula for the calculation the falling time of inverted pendulum. The result is expressed in terms of elliptic integrals of first kind. The asymptotic formula for small initial inclination value is also provided.

entry.title: Magnetic domain-walls and the relaxation method
entry.summary: The relaxation method used to solve boundary value problems is applied to study the variation of the magnetization orientation in several types of domain walls that occur in ferromagnetic materials. The algorithm is explained and applied to several cases: the Bloch wall in bulk magnetic systems, the radial wall in cylindrical wires and the N\'eel wall in thin films
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 1 table, 7 figures, submitted to Computational Materials Science

entry.title: The hydrino and other unlikely states
entry.summary: We discuss the tightly bound (hydrino) solution of the Klein-Gordon equation for the Coulomb potential in 3 dimensions. We show that a similarly tightly bound state occurs for the Dirac equation in 2 dimensions. These states are unphysical since they disappear if the nuclear charge distribution is taken to have an arbitrarily small but non-zero radius.

entry.title: Two falling-chain demonstrations based on Einstein's equivalence principle
entry.summary: Simple demonstrations based on the equivalence principle are given of how a folded chain and a horizontal flat chain fall down when one chain end is fixed to a rigid support.

entry.title: On the equipartition of kinetic energy in an ideal gas mixture
entry.summary: A refinement of an argument due to Maxwell for the equipartition of kinetic energy in a mixture of ideal gases with different masses is proposed. The argument is elementary, yet it may work as an illustration of the role of symmetry and independence postulates in kinetic theory.

entry.title: Quantum mechanical description of waveguides
entry.summary: In this paper, applying the spinor representation of the electromagnetic field, we present a quantum-mechanical description of waveguides. As an example of application, a potential qubit generated via photon tunneling is discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, no figure, to be published in Chinese Physics

entry.title: Penrose-Carter diagram for an uniformly accelerated observer
entry.summary: An uniformly accelerated observer can build his proper system of coordinates in a delimited sector of the flat Minkowski spacetime. The properties of the position and time coordinate lines for such an observer are studied and compared with the coordinate lines for an inertial observer in a Penrose-Carter diagram for this spacetime.

entry.title: Derivation of magnetic Coulomb's law for thin, semi-infinite solenoids
entry.summary: It is shown that the magnetic force between thin, semi-infinite solenoids obeys a Coulomb-type law, which corresponds to that for magnetic monopoles placed at the end points of each solenoid. We derive the magnetic Coulomb law from the basic principles of electromagnetism, namely from the Maxwell equations and the Lorentz force.

entry.title: Stability of Vertical Steady Rotation of an Ellipsoid On a Smooth Horizontal Plane
